dxy.name: US Dollar Index
dxy.description: Dollar vs a basket of major fiat currencies (euro-heavy). A relative measure — if all currencies debase together, DXY stays flat while purchasing power erodes.

gold.name: Gold
gold.description: The trust scoreboard. When gold rises alongside rising yields and a falling dollar, the market is pricing loss of confidence in the fiscal trajectory. Central banks buying gold = voting with their reserves.

us_10y.name: US 10Y Yield
us_10y.description: The stress thermometer for US fiscal health. Rising yields = market demanding more compensation to hold US debt. Above 5% is a yellow flag, above 6% likely forces Fed intervention.

fed_balance_sheet.name: Fed Balance Sheet
fed_balance_sheet.description: The ammo reserve of the buyer of last resort. Currently shrinking (QT), but any Treasury market stress forces re-expansion. Direction tells you whether fiscal dominance has gone from implicit to explicit.

debt_to_gdp.name: US Debt/GDP
debt_to_gdp.description: The denominator matters as much as the numerator. If GDP grows faster than debt, the ratio stabilizes. If not, the compounding math takes over. As long as this number climbs, all other pressures persist.

usd_reserves_share.name: USD Share of Reserves
usd_reserves_share.description: How much of global central bank reserves are held in dollars (IMF COFER data, quarterly, lagged). Dropped from 72% in 2000 — slow-moving but structural and largely irreversible.

csi300.name: CSI 300
csi300.description: China's benchmark equity index (top 300 A-shares). The cleanest signal of whether domestic and foreign capital is returning to Chinese markets.

usdcny.name: USD/CNY
usdcny.description: Dollar-yuan exchange rate. Falling = yuan strengthening. A sustained move below 7.00 signals meaningful capital flow shift toward China.

china_pmi.name: China Mfg PMI
china_pmi.description: NBS Manufacturing PMI. 50 = expansion/contraction line. Sustained above 51 confirms recovery is real; below 49 signals contraction.

china_retail_sales.name: China Retail Sales YoY
china_retail_sales.description: Monthly year-over-year growth in Chinese retail sales (NBS). The key gauge for whether China's consumption pivot thesis is playing out. Needs to sustain 4%+ and ideally move toward 5-6%.

kweb.name: China Internet ETF
kweb.description: KraneShares CSI China Internet ETF. Tracks Chinese tech (Alibaba, Tencent, PDD, etc.). A proxy for foreign investor sentiment on Chinese tech and regulatory risk.

oil.name: WTI Crude
oil.description: West Texas Intermediate crude oil. The one commodity with significant political suppression risk (Saudi deals, SPR releases). Tension between political will to lower prices and geological reality of tight supply.

uranium.name: Uranium (URA ETF)
uranium.description: Global X Uranium ETF. Proxy for the nuclear renaissance thesis — 30+ countries committed to tripling nuclear capacity. Supply constrained: Russia controls 40% of global enrichment.

copper.name: Copper
copper.description: The electrification bellwether. EVs use 3-4x more copper than ICE vehicles. Data centers, wind turbines, grid upgrades all need copper. Supply growth structurally constrained (mines take 7-15 years). Goldman calls it 'the new oil.'

qqq.name: Nasdaq 100 ETF
qqq.description: Tracks the 100 largest Nasdaq-listed non-financial companies. AI-heavy (Mag7 dominant). Watch QQQ vs SMH divergence to gauge whether AI beneficiary rotation is underway.

smh.name: Semiconductor ETF
smh.description: VanEck Semiconductor ETF. The AI picks-and-shovels trade (Nvidia, TSMC, ASML). If SMH underperforms QQQ, leadership is rotating from builders to enablers/adopters.

energy_cpi.name: Energy Services CPI YoY
energy_cpi.description: Year-over-year change in energy services prices (BLS). The hottest CPI component — directly tied to AI data center power demand. Above 7% creates real political backlash against AI deployment.

gsci_spy_ratio.name: Commodities / S&P 500
gsci_spy_ratio.description: GSG/SPY ratio — the broadest measure of real vs financial asset performance. A sustained move above 1.0 confirms the regime change from financial assets to hard assets. Currently turning from decades-long lows.

eurusd.name: EUR/USD
eurusd.description: The euro is DXY's largest component (~58%). EUR/USD rising = dollar weakening in its most liquid pair. Also reflects relative ECB vs Fed policy divergence.

yield_curve.name: 10Y-2Y Spread
yield_curve.description: The classic recession signal. Inverted (negative) = market pricing rate cuts ahead. Re-steepening after inversion historically precedes recessions within 6-18 months.

tips_5y.name: US 5Y TIPS (Real Yield)
tips_5y.description: The real cost of money after inflation. When negative, holding cash loses purchasing power — the engine that drives capital into gold and hard assets. Gromen's key metric for fiscal dominance.

breakeven_10y.name: 10Y Breakeven Inflation
breakeven_10y.description: Market-implied inflation expectation for the next 10 years. Rising breakevens = market pricing structurally higher inflation. Directly validates or challenges the debasement thesis.

hy_spread.name: HY Credit Spread (OAS)
hy_spread.description: High-yield bond spread over Treasuries. Widening = stress in credit markets, risk-off. Tight spreads = complacency. A spike above 5% historically signals recession risk.

tga.name: Treasury General Account
tga.description: The US government's checking account at the Fed. Drawdowns inject liquidity into markets (bullish). Refills (post-debt-ceiling) drain it. Liquidity plumbing that moves risk assets.

silver.name: Silver
silver.description: Dual identity: monetary metal (like gold) AND industrial metal (solar panels, electronics). The silver market is in structural deficit. Outperforms gold in bull runs, more volatile.

natgas.name: Natural Gas
natgas.description: Key energy source for power generation. AI data centers are driving massive new electricity demand, tightening the gas market. Also a geopolitical commodity (Russia/Europe, LNG exports).

sp500.name: S&P 500
sp500.description: The broad US equity benchmark. Tracks overall market health. Compare with QQQ/SMH to see whether tech is leading or lagging the broader market.

xlu.name: Utilities ETF (XLU)
xlu.description: The 'boring' AI winner. Data centers need massive electricity — utilities are the enablers. XLU outperforming tech = market rotating into AI infrastructure over AI hype.

vix.name: VIX
vix.description: The 'fear gauge'. Measures S&P 500 implied volatility. Below 15 = complacency, above 25 = elevated fear, above 35 = panic. Spikes tend to be short-lived but signal regime shifts.

btc.name: Bitcoin
btc.description: Digital debasement hedge. Correlates with global liquidity — when central banks expand balance sheets, BTC tends to rise. Also a barometer of risk appetite and monetary system distrust.

cb_gold_buying.name: Central Bank Gold Buying
cb_gold_buying.description: Quarterly data from World Gold Council. Central banks have been net buyers since 2010, accelerating post-2022 (sanctions on Russia). This is the structural floor under gold — sovereign entities voting to de-dollarize.

hsi.name: Hang Seng Index
hsi.description: Hong Kong's benchmark — the offshore window into Chinese equities. More sensitive to global capital flows and foreign sentiment toward China than onshore CSI 300.

eem.name: MSCI Emerging Markets ETF
eem.description: Broad EM equity benchmark. Tracks whether capital is flowing into or out of developing markets. EM outperforming DM = dollar-weakness + fragmentation trade working.
